Comment: Shell (1975: 174, 398) and Oliveira (2014: 459, 398) reconstruct *ʂao. Kasharari presents the form ʂahu [ʂa'hwu] (Lanes 2005, in Oliveira 2014). For Matses/Mayoruna we consider as evidence the final consonant in mɨ-ʂ‘wrist bone’, taɨ-ʂ‘ankle bone’, and ʂomoʂ‘needle made of bone’ (Fleck et al. 2012).

Comment: Girard reconstructs *-me[re] based on Tacana –meand Cavineña –mere. To this we can now add Ese’ Ejja -mee and Araona -me.
Girard additionally lists age for Warisa.
Girard additionally lists -a(-) for the Warayo.
Girard additionally lists beta, beabué and béka for Sapibokona, Warayo and Chama respectively.
